member.summary: Determines if the cache will be used as a read-only cache. Tells the cache model that is allowed to pass back a reference to the object existing in the cache.
member.remarks: The IsReadOnly properties works in conjonction with the IsSerializable propertie.

member.summary: Summary description for MemoryCacheLevel.

member.name: F:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Configuration.Cache.Memory.MemoryCacheLevel.Weak
member.summary: Constant for weak caching This cache model is probably the best choice in most cases. It will increase performance for popular results, but it will absolutely release the memory to be used in allocating other objects, assuming that the results are not currently in use. References an object while still allowing it to be garbage collected.

member.name: F:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Configuration.Cache.Memory.MemoryCacheLevel.Strong
member.summary:
Constant for strong caching. This cache model will guarantee that the results stay in memory until the cache is explicitly flushed. This is ideal for results that are:
very small
absolutely static
used very often
The advantage is that performance will be very good for this particular query. The disadvantage is that if the memory used by these results is needed, then it will not be released to make room for other objects (possibly more important objects).

member.summary: Creates a new instance of CacheLevel

member.name: T:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Exceptions.DataMapperException
member.summary: The DataMapperException is thrown when an error in the SqlMapper component occurs.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Exceptions.DataMapperException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks:
This constructor initializes the
Message property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Exceptions.DataMapperException.#ctor(System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.remarks: This constructor initializes the Message property of the new instance using the message parameter.
member.param: The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Exceptions.DataMapperException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.
member.remarks: This constructor initializes the Message property of the new instance to the Message property of the passed in exception.
member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Exceptions.DataMapperException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.remarks: An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the InnerException property. The InnerException property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the InnerException property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
member.param: The message that describes the error.
The exception that caused the error

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Exceptions.DataMapperException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.
member.remarks: This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
member.param: The that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.ISqlMapper.Insert(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Executes a Sql INSERT statement. Insert is a bit different from other update methods, as it provides facilities for returning the primary key of the newly inserted row (rather than the effected rows). This functionality is of course optional.
The parameter object is generally used to supply the input data for the INSERT values.
member.param: The name of the statement to execute.
member.returns: The primary key of the newly inserted row. This might be automatically generated by the RDBMS, or selected from a sequence table or other source.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.SqlMapper.Insert(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Executes a Sql INSERT statement. Insert is a bit different from other update methods, as it provides facilities for returning the primary key of the newly inserted row (rather than the effected rows). This functionality is of course optional.
The parameter object is generally used to supply the input data for the INSERT values.
member.param: The name of the statement to execute.
member.returns: The primary key of the newly inserted row. This might be automatically generated by the RDBMS, or selected from a sequence table or other source.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.SqlMapper.Update(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Executes a Sql UPDATE statement. Update can also be used for any other update statement type, such as inserts and deletes. Update returns the number of rows effected.
The parameter object is generally used to supply the input data for the UPDATE values as well as the WHERE clause parameter(s).
member.param: The name of the statement to execute.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.SqlMapper.Delete(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Executes a Sql DELETE statement. Delete returns the number of rows effected.
member.param: The name of the statement to execute.

member.name: T:SqlBatis.DataMapper.TypeHandlers.IParameterSetter
member.summary: Allows parameters to be set on the underlying prepared IDbCommand. TypeHandlerCallback implementations use this interface to process values before they are set on the IDbCommand.
member.remarks: There is no need to implement this. The implementation will be passed into the TypeHandlerCallback automatically.

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.TypeHandlers.IParameterSetter.DataParameter
member.summary: Returns the underlying IDataParameter

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.TypeHandlers.IParameterSetter.Value
member.summary: Get the parameter value

member.name: T:SqlBatis.DataMapper.TypeHandlers.IResultGetter
member.summary: Allows values to be retrieved from the underlying IDataReader. TypeHandlerCallback implementations use this interface to get values that they can subsequently manipulate before having them returned. * or index with these methods.
member.remarks: There is no need to implement this. The implementation will be passed into the TypeHandlerCallback automatically.

member.summary: Returns the underlying IDataReader

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.TypeHandlers.IResultGetter.Value
member.summary: Get the parameter value

member.name: T:SqlBatis.DataMapper.TypeHandlers.ITypeHandlerCallback
member.summary:
A simple interface for implementing custom type handlers.
Using this interface, you can implement a type handler that will perform customized processing before parameters are set on a IDbCommand and after values are retrieved from a IDataReader. Using a custom type handler you can extend the framework to handle types that are not supported, or handle supported types in a different way. For example, you might use a custom type handler to implement proprietary BLOB support (e.g. Oracle), or you might use it to handle booleans using "Y" and "N" instead of the more typical 0/1.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.TypeHandlers.ITypeHandlerCallback.SetParameter(SqlBatis.DataMapper.TypeHandlers.IParameterSetter,System.Object)
member.summary: Performs processing on a value before it is used to set the parameter of a IDbCommand.
member.param: The interface for setting the value on the IDbCommand.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.TypeHandlers.ITypeHandlerCallback.GetResult(SqlBatis.DataMapper.TypeHandlers.IResultGetter)
member.summary: Performs processing on a value before after it has been retrieved from a IDataReader.
member.param: The interface for getting the value from the IDataReader.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.TypeHandlers.ITypeHandlerCallback.ValueOf(System.String)
member.summary: Casts the string representation of a value into a type recognized by this type handler. This method is used to translate nullValue values into types that can be appropriately compared. If your custom type handler cannot support nullValues, or if there is no reasonable string representation for this type (e.g. File type), you can simply return the String representation as it was passed in. It is not recommended to return null, unless null was passed in.

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.TypeHandlers.ITypeHandlerCallback.NullValue
member.summary: The null value for this type

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.DbProvider.AllowMARS
member.summary: Tell us if this provider allows having multiple open with the same .
member.remarks: It's a new feature in ADO.NET 2.0 and Sql Server 2005 that allows for multiple forward only read only result sets (MARS). Some databases have supported this functionality for a long time : Not Supported : DB2, MySql.Data, OLE DB provider [except Sql Server 2005 when using MDAC 9], SQLite, Obdc Supported : Sql Server 2005, Npgsql

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.DbProvider.DbConnectionClass
member.summary: The connection class name to use.

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.DbProvider.UseParameterPrefixInSql
member.summary: Does this ConnectionProvider require the use of a Named Prefix in the SQL statement.
member.remarks: The OLE DB/ODBC .NET Provider does not support named parameters for passing parameters to an SQL Statement or a stored procedure called by an IDbCommand when CommandType is set to Text. For example, SqlClient requires select * from simple where simple_id = @simple_id If this is false, like with the OleDb or Obdc provider, then it is assumed that the ? can be a placeholder for the parameter in the SQL statement when CommandType is set to Text.

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.DbProvider.UseParameterPrefixInParameter
member.summary: Does this ConnectionProvider require the use of the Named Prefix when trying to reference the Parameter in the Command's Parameter collection.
member.remarks: This is really only useful when the UseParameterPrefixInSql = true. When this is true the code will look like IDbParameter param = cmd.Parameters["@paramName"], if this is false the code will be IDbParameter param = cmd.Parameters["paramName"] - ie - Oracle.

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.DbProvider.UsePositionalParameters
member.summary: The OLE DB/OBDC .NET Provider uses positional parameters that are marked with a question mark (?) instead of named parameters.

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.DbProvider.SetDbParameterSize
member.summary: Used to indicate whether or not the provider supports parameter size.
member.remarks: See JIRA-49 about SQLite.Net provider not supporting parameter size.

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.DbProvider.SetDbParameterPrecision
member.summary: Used to indicate whether or not the provider supports parameter precision.
member.remarks: See JIRA-49 about SQLite.Net provider not supporting parameter precision.

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.DbProvider.SetDbParameterScale
member.summary: Used to indicate whether or not the provider supports a parameter scale.
member.remarks: See JIRA-49 about SQLite.Net provider not supporting parameter scale.

member.name: T:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Exceptions.ConfigurationException
member.summary: A ConfigurationException is thrown when an error has occured in the configuration process.
member.remarks: When this exception occurs check the .xml or .config file.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Exceptions.ConfigurationException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: This constructor initializes the Message property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Exceptions.ConfigurationException.#ctor(System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.remarks: This constructor initializes the Message property of the new instance to the Message property of the passed in exception.
member.param: The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Exceptions.ConfigurationException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.
member.remarks: This constructor initializes the Message property of the new instance using the message parameter.
member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Exceptions.ConfigurationException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.remarks: An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the InnerException property. The InnerException property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the InnerException property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
member.param: The message that describes the error.
The exception that caused the error

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Exceptions.ConfigurationException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Exception class with serialized data.
member.remarks: This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
member.param: The that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

Classes that implement this interface may optional implement a constructor that accepts a which will contain zero or more user supplied configuration properties.
The SqlBatis.DataMapper assembly ships with the following built-in implementations:
Writes output to Console.Out
Writes output to the System.Diagnostics.Trace sub-system
Ignores all messages

member.summary: Is the current page the first page ? True if the current page is the first page or if only a single page exists.

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Pagination.IPaginatedList.IsMiddlePage
member.summary: Is the current page a middle page (i.e. not first or last) ? Return True if the current page is not the first or last page, and more than one page exists (always returns false if only a single page exists).

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Pagination.IPaginatedList.IsLastPage
member.summary: Is the current page the last page ? Return True if the current page is the last page or if only a single page exists.

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Pagination.IPaginatedList.IsNextPageAvailable
member.summary: Is a page available after the current page ? Return True if the next page is available

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Pagination.IPaginatedList.IsPreviousPageAvailable
member.summary: Is a page available before the current page ? Return True if the previous page is available

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Pagination.IPaginatedList.NextPage
member.summary: Moves to the next page after the current page. If the current page is the last page, wrap to the first page.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Pagination.IPaginatedList.PreviousPage
member.summary: Moves to the page before the current page. If the current page is the first page, wrap to the last page.

member.name: M:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Pagination.IPaginatedList.GotoPage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves to a specified page. If the specified page is beyond the last page, wrap to the first page. If the specified page is before the first page, wrap to the last page.
member.param: The index of the specified page.

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Pagination.IPaginatedList.PageIndex
member.summary: Returns the current page index, which is a zero based integer. All paginated list implementations should know what index they are on, even if they don't know the ultimate boundaries (min/max)

member.summary: Specifies the isolation level of a transaction.

member.name: F:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Transaction.IsolationLevel.Serializable
member.summary: Volatile data can be read but not modified, and no new data can be added during the transaction.

member.name: F:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Transaction.IsolationLevel.RepeatableRead
member.summary: Volatile data can be read but not modified during the transaction. New data may be added during the transaction.

member.name: F:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Transaction.IsolationLevel.ReadCommitted
member.summary: Volatile data cannot be read during the transaction, but can be modified.

member.name: F:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Transaction.IsolationLevel.ReadUncommitted
member.summary: Volatile data can be read and modified during the transaction.

member.name: F:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Transaction.IsolationLevel.Unspecified
member.summary: Volatile data can be read but not modified, and no new data can be added during the transaction.

member.summary: Length of time that the transaction waits before automatically closing itself

member.summary: The isolation level of the transaction.

member.name: T:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Transaction.TransactionScopeOptions
member.summary: Describes how a transaction scope is associated with a transaction.

member.name: F:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Transaction.TransactionScopeOptions.Required
member.summary: The transaction scope must be associated with a transaction. If we are in a transaction scope join it. If we aren't, create a new one.

member.name: F:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Transaction.TransactionScopeOptions.RequiresNew
member.summary: Always creates a new transaction scope.

member.name: F:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Transaction.TransactionScopeOptions.Supported
member.summary: Don't need a transaction scope, but if we are in a transaction scope then join it.

member.name: F:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Transaction.TransactionScopeOptions.NotSupported
member.summary: Means that cannot cannot be associated with a transaction scope.

member.name: F:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Transaction.TransactionScopeOptions.Mandatory
member.summary: The transaction scope must be associated with an existing transaction scope.

member.name: T:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Utilities.ConfigWatcherHandler
member.summary: Class used to watch config files.
member.remarks: Uses the to monitor changes to a specified file. Because multiple change notifications may be raised when the file is modified, a timer is used to compress the notifications into a single event. The timer waits for the specified time before delivering the event notification. If any further change notifications arrive while the timer is waiting it is reset and waits again for the specified time to elapse.

member.name: F:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Utilities.ConfigWatcherHandler._timer
member.summary: The timer used to compress the notification events.

member.summary: The default amount of time to wait after receiving notification before reloading the config file.

member.name: P:SqlBatis.DataMapper.Utilities.StringTokenizer.TokenNumber
member.summary: Returns the number of tokens in the String using the current deliminter set. This is the number of times nextToken() can return before it will generate an exception.
